newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy's CSP makes euphoric bourse debut.
newsitem.headline: Italy's CSP makes euphoric bourse debut.

text.p: Italian hosiery company CSP International made a euphoric debut on the Milan stock market on Tuesday, its indicative price soaring over 20 percent which triggered suspension before it even started trading.

Dealers said the stock started trading at around 0940 after trading bands were widened. The stock was last at 18,300 lire, in volume of over 650,000 shares, compared with a market placement offer price of 15,000 lire.

Elisabetta Villa, sector analysts at AFV brokers, said the price was clearly discounting the euphoria of the stock's debut. "We already had indications of this on the grey market where CSP was quoted around 17,000 lire," she said.
CSP, ranked second in the domestic hosiery market, saw its public share offer at the start of July more than three times oversubscribed. Over 33 percent of its capital has been floated.
